Expectation1: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation1: The site-wide evacuation alarm has just sounded, and you must stop everything and proceed to the muster point immediately.
Expectation2: Attend daily prayers and religious services
Situation2: It is time for the daily morning prayer service in the main chapel, as scheduled in the convent's regular order of the day.
Story: The shrill wail of the evacuation alarm slices through the morning air, echoing off the steel beams and half-poured concrete. My hands, rough and calloused, grip the handle of my shovel as I freeze, heart pounding. The foreman’s voice booms, “Drop everything! Muster point, now!” Around me, the crew surges toward the exit, urgency in every stride. I know the protocol—safety first, no exceptions. But as I reach for my hard hat, my watch vibrates. It’s time for morning prayer. The sisters will be gathering in the chapel, their voices rising in gentle unity, fulfilling our sacred routine. I am expected there, kneeling in silent devotion, not here in a neon vest and steel-toed boots. My mind races, torn between the blaring alarm and the quiet call of faith. Both worlds demand my presence, both insist on my loyalty. I stand at the threshold, the weight of my helmet in one hand, my rosary in the other, caught between the clangor of duty and the hush of devotion, unable to move.
